comments:
build i0529-0105, linux-motif, jdk 1.4.2_03

- ran Eclipse 2.1.3 (GTK) on a workspace
- imported a bunch of binary projects
- created a new Hello World plug-in
- created a Runtime Workbench and ran it
- Exited Eclipse 2.1.3

- Ran build i0529-GTK on the same workspace
- did some stuff, ran a runtime workbench, etc
- Exited Eclipse

- Ran build i0529-motif on the same workspace
- tried to run the same runtime workbench launch config
- realized that the OS/ARCH/NL values were hard-coded from the time I created it
so it wouldn't work
- created a new Runtime Workbench
- noticed the WS was now Motif
- tried to run the new Runtime Workbench and nothing happened
- Was not prompted to open a config log or anything
- ran again with -consoleLog and captured the following output in the console

!SESSION Jun 01, 2004 11:33:38.785 ---------------------------------------------

I'm pretty sure that someone investigated this one but don't see any 
annotations.  Moving to Rafael for confirmation/investigation.  Marking as 
investigate for RC2

I could reproduce the problem, but running 3.0-gtk after running 2.1-gtk was
enough (didn't have to try running 3.0-motif).

The reason the problem happenned is that I was targetting a 3.0 build (the
default) having a bunch of 2.1 plugins in my workspace. Changing the target
platform to be the 2.1 install fixed the problem.

DJ, I knwo it is been a while since you reported this, but do you remember if
you changed the target platform to be the 2.1 install before trying to run?
I don't believe that I changed my target platform but I may have.

So that (you didn't change yur target platform) would explain the problem. You
ran having a mix of 2.1 plugins (from the workspace) and 3.0 plugins (from the
default target platform).

Closing as user error. Please reopen if you don't agree...
